content.raw: I'm getting compiler warnings that the `hi_act, lo_act, hi_act_erp, lo_act_erp` variables will be used uninitialized if the `friction_model` is invalid. Can you add some default values to these variables in this `else` block to silence the compiler warning?
content.html: I'm getting compiler warnings that the hi_act, lo_act, hi_act_erp, lo_act_erp variables will be used uninitialized if the friction_model is invalid. Can you add some default values to these variables in this else block to silence the compiler warning?

update.description:
To enable  the cone friction model, define the macro `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.h?at=cone_friction#cl-57). Comment this line to stick with ODE's pyramid friction model. 

Maximum dissipation tests added [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/test/integration/physics_friction.cc?at=cone_friction#cl-302).  To test the cone friction model, run this command: 

`./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_friction --gtest_filter="*Dissipation/0" `

[issue 1515](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1515/j_orig-not-correct-inside-ode-quickstep) is fixed [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=cone_friction#cl-378)
update.title: cone friction model

content.raw:
The enums are defined at ODE side [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/7406cdfc3acc8f20b9dc498c3644cc8187623231/deps/opende/src/objects.h?at=cone_friction#cl-52), the place here is at `Gazebo/Physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc`.   
Is there a way to include [deps/opende/src/objects.h](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/7406cdfc3acc8f20b9dc498c3644cc8187623231/deps/opende/src/objects.h?at=cone_friction)?

The enums are defined at ODE side here, the place here is at Gazebo/Physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc.
Is there a way to include deps/opende/src/objects.h?

content.raw:
I checked the two places you mentioned about enums, which works as bitmasks for several fields in the enum as a small group.  
Here for the friction model, they should be mutual exclusive. We can only choose `1` friction model from the enum list.  
So there seems no need to follow the `2^1, 2^2, 2^3, ...` enum style
content.html:
I checked the two places you mentioned about enums, which works as bitmasks for several fields in the enum as a small group.
Here for the friction model, they should be mutual exclusive. We can only choose 1 friction model from the enum list.
So there seems no need to follow the 2^1, 2^2, 2^3, ... enum style

update.description:
To enable  the cone friction model, define the macro `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.h?at=cone_friction#cl-57). Comment this line to stick with ODE's pyramid friction model. 

Maximum dissipation tests added [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/test/integration/physics_friction.cc?at=cone_friction#cl-302).  To test the cone friction model, run this command: 

`./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_friction --gtest_filter="*Dissipation/0" `

[issue 1515](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1515/j_orig-not-correct-inside-ode-quickstep) is fixed [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=cone_friction#cl-378)
update.title: cone friction model

To enable  the cone friction model, define the macro `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.h?at=cone_friction#cl-57). Comment this line to stick with ODE's pyramid friction model. 

Maximum dissipation tests added [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/test/integration/physics_friction.cc?at=cone_friction#cl-302).  To test the cone friction model, run this command: 

`./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_friction --gtest_filter="*Dissipation/0" `

[issue 1515](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1515/j_orig-not-correct-inside-ode-quickstep) is fixed [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=cone_friction#cl-378)
